info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 12:22PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CAMERON AND SOUTH CENTRAL CALCASIEU PARISHES THROUGH 1245 PM CST... At 1222 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hackberry, or 8 miles northeast of Sabine National Wildlife, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Grand Lake, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Hackberry, Carlyss, and Heberts Marina. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 17 and 25. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
